Did you know that the tmap package has its own website?

It contains examples for each tmap function and a few articles.

Visit it at https://t.co/ZaMUkjxy7j

#tmap #rstats #rspatial https://t.co/wsqdcsmRnc

furrr 0.2.0 is now on CRAN! 🎉

furrr is an #rstats 📦 that combines purrr + future so you can `map()` in parallel.

This update comes two years after the initial release, and contains a number of bug fixes, `future_walk()`, and five new vignettes!

https://t.co/ISghqhsGTT

Great newly-updated #rstats-modelling resource by @statsdatasci:
https://t.co/MqXRK2DWLa https://t.co/DD5Q2qJt9K https://t.co/zGqwCz4XIv

Coinciding with the workshop, I've updated my mixed model doc with a specific chapter on Bayesian models, some code cleanup, and other stuff.

https://t.co/A9EkiG75OL

#Rstats #mixedmodels #lme4 #brms

Some #Rstats packages create ggplot objects that can be tricky to edit. 

I just discovered that you can use the ggplot_build() function to disassemble a plot and figure out how it was created. You can then make the needed edits and rebuild the plot 🪄https://t.co/SYdZ8UQ155

Looking for a beginner’s guide to Superlearning, AKA Stacking? 🥞
